FOUND IN: Duo: Two individuals working together harmoniously, commonly used to describe partnerships in musical acts or dance routines.
Silver birch (Betula pendula - striking white trunk and delicate leaves)
Shrew: A tamed, wild animal, typically referring to a feral or untamed creature that has been domesticated.
Cross-over squads (in rare cases, when teams from different leagues join forces temporarily)
Chronic sinusitis: long-term inflammation of the sinuses that can affect adjacent structures and lead to secondary issues within head cavities.
Gaping wound: An injury with a wide opening and visible tissue exposure.
Gowns: Historically, a frock refers to an old-fashioned term for dresses or gowns worn by women in the past
